refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Known Implementations
refsect1.para: GtkEditable is implemented by GtkEntry, GtkOldEditable, GtkSpinButton and GtkText.

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "changed" void user_function (GtkEditable *editable, gpointer user_data); "delete-text" void user_function (GtkEditable *editable, gint start_pos, gint end_pos, gpointer user_data); "insert-text" void user_function (GtkEditable *editable, gchar *new_text, gint new_text_length, gint *position, gpointer user_data);

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkEditable interface is an interface which should be implemented by text editing widgets, such as GtkEntry and GtkText. It contains functions for generically manipulating an editable widget, a large number of action signals used for key bindings, and several signals that an application can connect to to modify the behavior of a widget.

refsect2.title: struct GtkEditable
refsect2.para:
The GtkEditable structure contains the following fields. (These fields should be considered read-only. They should never be set by an application.)
guint selection_start; the starting position of the selected characters in the widget.
guint selection_end; the end position of the selected characters in the widget.
guint editable; a flag indicating whether or not the widget is editable by the user.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_select_region ()
refsect2.para: Selects a region of text. The characters that are selected are those characters at positions from start_pos up to, but not including end_pos. If end_pos is negative, then the the characters selected will be those characters from start_pos to the end of the text.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_get_selection_bounds ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current selection bounds, if there is a selection.

listitem.simpara: location to store the starting position, or NULL.
location to store the end position, or NULL.
TRUE if there is a selection.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_insert_text ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_editable_insert_text (GtkEditable *editable, const gchar *new_text, gint new_text_length, gint *position);
refsect2.para: Inserts text at a given position.

listitem.simpara: the length of the text to insert, in bytes
an inout parameter. The caller initializes it to the position at which to insert the text. After the call it points at the position after the newly inserted text.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_delete_text ()
refsect2.para: Deletes a sequence of characters. The characters that are deleted are those characters at positions from start_pos up to, but not including end_pos. If end_pos is negative, then the the characters deleted will be those characters from start_pos to the end of the text.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_get_chars ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves a sequence of characters. The characters that are retrieved are those characters at positions from start_pos up to, but not including end_pos. If end_pos is negative, then the the characters retrieved will be those characters from start_pos to the end of the text.

listitem.simpara: the characters in the indicated region. The result must be freed with g_free() when the application is finished with it.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_cut_clipboard ()
refsect2.para: Causes the characters in the current selection to be copied to the clipboard and then deleted from the widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_copy_clipboard ()
refsect2.para: Causes the characters in the current selection to be copied to the clipboard.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_paste_clipboard ()
refsect2.para: Causes the contents of the clipboard to be pasted into the given widget at the current cursor position.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_delete_selection ()
refsect2.para: Deletes the current contents of the widgets selection and disclaims the selection.

listitem.simpara: the position of the cursor. The cursor is displayed before the character with the given (base 0) index in the widget. The value must be less than or equal to the number of characters in the widget. A value of -1 indicates that the position should be set after the last character in the entry. Note that this position is in characters, not in bytes.

the position of the cursor. The cursor is displayed before the character with the given (base 0) index in the widget. The value will be less than or equal to the number of characters in the widget. Note that this position is in characters, not in bytes.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_set_editable ()
refsect2.para: Determines if the user can edit the text in the editable widget or not.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the user is allowed to edit the text in the widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_editable_get_editable ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves whether editable is editable. See gtk_editable_set_editable().

refsect2.title: The "changed" signal
refsect2.para: Indicates that the user has changed the contents of the widget.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "delete-text" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEditable *editable, gint start_pos, gint end_pos, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when text is deleted from the widget by the user. The default handler for this signal will normally be responsible for inserting the text, so by connecting to this signal and then stopping the signal with gtk_signal_emit_stop(), it is possible to modify the inserted text, or prevent it from being inserted entirely. The start_pos and end_pos parameters are interpreted as for gtk_editable_delete_text()

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "insert-text" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEditable *editable, gchar *new_text, gint new_text_length, gint *position, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when text is inserted into the widget by the user. The default handler for this signal will normally be responsible for inserting the text, so by connecting to this signal and then stopping the signal with gtk_signal_emit_stop(), it is possible to modify the inserted text, or prevent it from being inserted entirely.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
the length of the new text.
the position at which to insert the new text. this is an in-out paramter. After the signal emission is finished, it should point after the newly inserted text.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
